question_text: Why might a mobile carrier charge extra for hotspot use even though mobile data is already part of the plan?
answer_options: Hotspot traffic uses different radio frequencies
Carriers must pay licensing fees for hotspot support
Hotspot data may be prioritized or routed differently
Data over a hotspot is encrypted and costs more to deliver
correct_answer: Hotspot data may be prioritized or routed differently
explanation: Carriers often segment hotspot usage from normal device usage to manage network load and may apply different routing, QoS policies, or throttling thresholds.
